summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 among Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) staff at various facilities discussing technical issues with the NICEVision camera/security system software following a Windows update. The chain includes signatures from staff at FDC Houston, FDC Miami, FCC Victorville, FCI Danbury, and FCI Otisville. It reveals internal BOP communications and system management concerns.

persons.name: Justin Abromavage
persons.role: BOP staff member seeking technical help
persons.context: Initiates the email chain from FCI Otisville on August 8, 2019, seeking help or advice for a 'Database Error' when trying to log into the NICEVision Administrator to unlock an account.

keyFacts: The document is an internal BOP email chain from August 2019 discussing technical issues with the NICEVision security camera system software.
The primary issue reported is a 'Database Error' pop-up that crashes the NICEVision Administrator application, preventing account unlocks.
Multiple BOP facilities (Houston, Miami, Victorville, Danbury, Otisville) are represented in the discussion, indicating a widespread system.
The suspected cause of the issues is a recent Windows update pushed by the BOP Central Office.
The correspondence reveals routine operational and IT support communications within the BOP, unrelated to any specific inmate or case details.
